meanings.definition: Those who do not like or approve of something.
meanings.sent1: The mislikers of spicy food always choose milder options.
meanings.sent2: The mislikers of rainy days prefer to stay indoors.
meanings.sent3: The mislikers of early mornings often hit the snooze button multiple times.
meanings.sent4: In a garden full of flowers, the mislikers of bees were always on edge.
meanings.sent5: The mislikers of horror movies cover their eyes during the scary scenes.

meanings.definition: People who have a negative opinion or feeling towards something.
meanings.sent1: At the meeting, the mislikers of change voiced their concerns.
meanings.sent2: The mislikers of the new policy were vocal in their opposition.
meanings.sent3: The mislikers of long meetings often find ways to sneak out early.
meanings.sent4: In a group of friends, she stood out as the mislikers of gossip.
meanings.sent5: The mislikers of cold weather always bundle up in layers.
